original_content:
message_id: 16ebeec88231b733
subject   : Subject: A CHRISTIAN SHOULD BE (12-1-2019)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 30 Nov 2019 18:46:43 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*The Answer:*

A mind through which Christ thinks.

A voice through which Christ speaks.

A heart through which Christ loves.

A hand through which Christ helps.

*How is Christ using you?*

* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
The Answer: A mind through which Christ thinks. A voice
through which Christ speaks. A heart through which Christ
loves. A hand through which Christ helps. How is Christ
using you?
original_verse_text: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to have the mind of Christ, to be transformed by the renewing of our minds, that we may discern Your good, pleasing, and perfect will. May our lives be a reflection of Your love, a voice that speaks Your truth, and hands that extend Your compassion to a world in need. Use us, Lord, as vessels through which Your Son can work, that we may bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: The Answer: A mind through which Christ thinks. A voice through which Christ speaks. A heart through which Christ loves. A hand through which Christ helps. How is Christ using you?
subject: A Christian Should Be
verse_text: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus.

original_content:
message_id: 16ec415b6c104ae9
subject   : Subject: DECISIONS (12-2-2019)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 1 Dec 2019 18:49:48 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today's Verse:*

*All who believe in God’s Son have eternal life.*

*Those who don’t obey the Son will never *

*experience eternal life, but the wrath of God*

*remains upon them. *(Jn. 3:36)

*Today’s Thought:*

In this verse Jesus sets before us the greatest choice

in life. It is up to us to decide today whom we will

obey (Joshua 24:25), and God want us to choose

Him and life (Deut. 30:15-20. The wrath of God is

God’s final judgement and rejection of sinners.

To put off the choice is to choose *not* to follow

Christ *Indecision is a fatal decision. *

* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
In this verse Jesus sets before us the greatest choice in
life. It is up to us to decide today whom we will obey
(Joshua 24:25), and God want us to choose Him and life
(Deuteronomy 30:15-20. The wrath of God is God’s final judgment
and rejection of sinners. To put off the choice is to choose
not to follow Christ Indecision is a fatal decision.
original_verse_text:
All who believe in God’s Son have eternal life. Those who
don’t obey the Son will never experience eternal life, but
the wrath of God remains upon them.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the gravity of the choice set before us. Help us to heed the words of Your Son, that those who believe in Him have eternal life, while those who reject Him will face Your righteous judgment. Grant us the wisdom and courage to choose life, to obey and follow You, for Your ways are life-giving and true. May we not delay in making this most important decision, for indecision is a fatal choice. We ask this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: In this verse, Jesus sets before us the greatest choice in life. It is up to us to decide today whom we will obey (Joshua 24:15), and God wants us to choose Him and life (Deuteronomy 30:15-20). The wrath of God is God's final judgment and rejection of sinners. To put off the choice is to choose not to follow Christ. Indecision is a fatal decision.
subject: Decisions
verse_text:
All who believe in God’s Son have eternal life. Those who
don’t obey the Son will never experience eternal life, but
the wrath of God remains upon them.

original_content:
message_id: 16ec9475b20ae109
subject   : Subject: THE FUTILITY OF PRIDE (12-3-2019)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 2 Dec 2019 19:02:07 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today's Verse:*
"Blessed are the poor in spirit, for their's is the
kingdom of heaven." (Mt. 5:3)

*Today's Thoughts:*
What we should recognize in this verse is that we
must be willing to assume the role of a beggar to
enter into the kingdom of heaven. *Why?* because
pride will cause us not to admit we are wrong or
have compassion on our fellow man. It can even
cause us to live beyond our means (Ro. 13:8).
Pride also leads to rebellion (Ps. 10:4) and it can
even cause us to drift from our religious belief
(I Tim. 3:6). There is a Chinese proverb which
goes something like this: *"He who stands **on a *
*pedestal has no place to **go* *but to step down. *
*("pedestal" meaning pride)*
* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
What we should recognize in this verse is that we must be
willing to assume the role of a beggar to enter into the
kingdom of heaven. Why? because pride will cause us not to
admit we are wrong or have compassion on our fellow man. It
can even cause us to live beyond our means (Romans 13:8). Pride
also leads to rebellion (Psalm 10:4) and it can even cause us
to drift from our religious belief (I Timothy 3:6). There is a
Chinese proverb which goes something like this: "He who
stands on a pedestal has no place to go but to step down.
("pedestal" meaning pride)
original_verse_text:
"Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the
kingdom of heaven."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing our need for Your grace and mercy. Help us to let go of our pride, which can so easily lead us astray and separate us from You. May we be willing to assume the role of a beggar, acknowledging our dependence on You and Your kingdom. Teach us to have compassion on our fellow man, and to live in a way that honors You. We surrender our lives to You, Lord, that we may walk in the path of righteousness. Amen.
reflection: What we should recognize in this verse is that we must be willing to assume the role of a beggar to enter into the kingdom of heaven. Why? because pride will cause us not to admit we are wrong or have compassion on our fellow man. It can even cause us to live beyond our means (Romans 13:8). Pride also leads to rebellion (Psalm 10:4) and it can even cause us to drift from our religious belief (I Timothy 3:6). There is a Chinese proverb which goes something like this: "He who stands on a pedestal has no place to go but to step down. ("pedestal" meaning pride)
subject: The Futility of Pride
verse_text:
"Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the
kingdom of heaven."

original_content:
message_id: 16ed0b5587733c9c
subject   : Subject: FINDING TRUE HAPPINESS AND LIFE (12-4-2019)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 4 Dec 2019 05:39:36 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today's Verse:*
*"Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness,*
*for they **shall be satisfied. *(Mt. 5:6)

*Today's Thoughts:*
Happiness *is not* found in the pursuit of happiness. Life
*is not *found in the pursuit of life. *Both* are found in the
pursuit of God and His righteousness. Don't be fooled,
the end of our current emphasis on self *is not* life, *but*
disappointment and ultimately death! *If* we want to
discover TRUE LIFE, *then we must pursue the **things *
*of God and His** Spirit!*
* Pastor Al*






















Recipients
original_reflection_text:
Happiness is not found in the pursuit of happiness. Life
is not found in the pursuit of life. Both are found in the
pursuit of God and His righteousness. Don't be fooled,
the end of our current emphasis on self is not life, but
disappointment and ultimately death! If we want to
discover TRUE LIFE, then we must pursue the things
of God and His Spirit!
original_verse_text:
"Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness,
for they shall be satisfied.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, longing to be filled with the things of Your Spirit. Help us to set our minds on the things of God, for this is life and peace. May we hunger and thirst for Your righteousness, knowing that in You alone we will find true and lasting fulfillment. Guide us, Lord, to seek first Your kingdom and Your ways, that we may experience the abundant life You have promised. Amen.
reflection: Happiness is not found in the pursuit of happiness. Life is not found in the pursuit of life. Both are found in the pursuit of God and His righteousness. Don't be fooled, the end of our current emphasis on self is not life, but disappointment and ultimately death! If we want to discover true life, then we must pursue the things of God and His Spirit!
subject: Finding True Happiness and Life
verse_text:
"Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness,
for they shall be satisfied.

original_content:
message_id: 16ed632e90440151
subject   : Subject: AND THEN SOME
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 5 Dec 2019 07:14:51 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today's Verse**:*
Jesus taught the "and then some" principle. In the
Sermon on the Mount He said. *"And whoever compels*
*you to go one mile, go with him two.* (Mt. 5:41)
*Today's Thought:*
Let's look closely at the words of a successful
businessman when asked what the secret was
to his success. He merely said *" A Then Some"*
He had learned early in life that the difference
between average people and truly successful
people could be summed up in these three words.
Top people did what was expected "And Then Some!"
*Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
Let's look closely at the words of a successful
businessman when asked what the secret was
to his success. He merely said " A Then Some"
He had learned early in life that the difference
between average people and truly successful
people could be summed up in these three words.
Top people did what was expected "And Then Some!"
original_verse_text:
Jesus taught the "and then some" principle. In the
Sermon on the Mount He said. "And whoever compels
you to go one mile, go with him two.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that all we do should be done for Your glory. Help us to follow the example of the successful businessman, going above and beyond what is expected, not merely doing the minimum, but doing it "and then some." May we work diligently, as unto You, knowing that our true reward comes from You. Give us the strength and the willingness to go the extra mile, to serve with excellence, and to bring honor to Your name. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Let's look closely at the words of a successful businessman when asked what the secret was to his success. He merely said, "And Then Some." He had learned early in life that the difference between average people and truly successful people could be summed up in these three words. Top people did what was expected "and then some!"
subject: And then Some
verse_text:
Jesus taught the "and then some" principle. In the
Sermon on the Mount He said. "And whoever compels
you to go one mile, go with him two.

original_content:
message_id: 16ed903233000ec9
subject   : Subject: HOW DO WE HALLOW THE NAME OF GOD.
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 5 Dec 2019 20:21:32 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Verse *(12-6-2019)

*In the Lord's prayer, Jesus prayed. "Our Father who art in heaven,
hallowed be Your name."* (Mt 6:9)
*Today's Thought: *
To hallow the name of God is to regard it as holy, to treat it differently
from all other names. one of the ten commandments warned, "You shall not
misuse the name of the Lord your God, for the Lord will not hold anyone
guiltless who misuses His name" (Exod. 20:7).
*Those who hallow the name of God take special care to avoid light,
meaningless profane reference to God.
Pastor Al *
original_reflection_text:
To hallow the name of God is to regard it as holy, to treat
it differently from all other names. one of the ten
commandments warned, "You shall not misuse the name of the
Lord your God, for the Lord will not hold anyone guiltless
who misuses His name" (Exod. 20:7). Those who hallow the
name of God take special care to avoid light, meaningless
profane reference to God.
original_subject: HOW DO WE HALLOW THE NAME OF GOD.
original_verse_text:
In the Lord's prayer, Jesus prayed. "Our Father who art in
heaven, hallowed be Your name."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with reverence and awe, for Your name is holy and set apart from all others. Help us to hallow Your name, to treat it with the utmost care and respect, and to never use it lightly or in vain. May our words and actions always reflect the holiness of Your name, that we may bring glory to You. We ask this in the precious name of Jesus. Amen.
reflection: To hallow the name of God is to regard it as holy, to treat it differently from all other names. One of the ten commandments warned, "You shall not misuse the name of the Lord your God, for the Lord will not hold anyone guiltless who misuses His name" (Exod. 20:7). Those who hallow the name of God take special care to avoid light, meaningless, profane reference to God.
subject: How Do We Hallow the Name of God.
verse_text:
In the Lord's prayer, Jesus prayed. "Our Father who art in
heaven, hallowed be Your name."

original_content:
message_id: 16edddc42d26e3f8
subject   : Subject: JUDGE NOT (12-7-2019
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 6 Dec 2019 18:57:10 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

Jesus says: “*Judge not, that you be not judged. **For with what judgment
you use, you will be **judged; and with the measure you use it will **be
measured back to you.” *(Mt. 7:1-2)



*Today’s Thoughts:*

Let’s quite dwelling on the faults of others.

The church needs builders and workers—

not a wrecking crew. Let’s work on our own faults, then seek to help others
in a spirit of gentleness. *Remember it is easy to make **a mountain out of
a mole hill, all we need **to do is add a little dirt.*

* Pastor Al.*
original_reflection_text:
Let’s quit dwelling on the faults of others. The church
needs builders and workers— not a wrecking crew. Let’s work
on our own faults, then seek to help others in a spirit of
gentleness. Remember it is easy to make a mountain out of a
mole hill, all we need to do is add a little dirt.
==================================================================
prayer:

Lord, tame my tongue and humble my heart so I don’t magnify
others’ faults. Build in me a gentle spirit that works on my
own weaknesses first and restores others with compassion.
Make me a builder in Your church, not part of a wrecking
crew. (AI)
original_verse_text: Jesus says: "Judge not, that you be not judged. For with what judgment you use, you will be judged; and with the measure you use it will be measured back to you."
prayer: Heavenly Father, tame my tongue and humble my heart so I don't magnify others' faults. Build in me a gentle spirit that works on my own weaknesses first and restores others with compassion. Make me a builder in Your church, not part of a wrecking crew. Amen.
reflection: Let's quit dwelling on the faults of others. The church needs builders and workers—not a wrecking crew. Let's work on our own faults, then seek to help others in a spirit of gentleness. Remember, it is easy to make a mountain out of a molehill; all we need to do is add a little dirt. prayer: Lord, tame my tongue and humble my heart so I don't magnify others' faults. Build in me a gentle spirit that works on my own weaknesses first and restores others with compassion. Make me a builder in Your church, not part of a wrecking crew.
subject: Judge Not
verse_text: Jesus says: "Judge not, that you be not judged. For with what judgment you use, you will be judged; and with the measure you use it will be measured back to you."

original_content:
message_id: 16f0c3556541c9eb
subject   : Subject: THIS CHRISTMAS IS CHRIST HAPPY OVER US? (12-16-19)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 15 Dec 2019 18:57:00 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Thought:*

This is a question I am asking myself this year.


*Let Us All Give This Question Some Serious Thought!*



This was a *question* a little girl asked her mom.

How would you answer this question? Let us

all give this some serious thought. *Is the Lord *

*happy about us on His birthday?* Is He really

happy, because He sees within our hearts a deep,

true love for Him? Does He see a satisfying

love and not just a seasonal affection stirred up

by the festivities of Christmas? *Remember *

*what He wants more than anything else on *

*His birthday, IS THE LOVE OF OUR HEARTS. *

*Pastor Al*

(My son figured out the problem I was having with my computer)
original_reflection_text:
This is a question I am asking myself this year. Let Us All
Give This Question Some Serious Thought! This was a question
a little girl asked her mom. How would you answer this
question? Let us all give this some serious thought. Is the
Lord happy about us on His birthday? Is He really happy,
because He sees within our hearts a deep, true love for Him?
Does He see a satisfying love and not just a seasonal
affection stirred up by the festivities of Christmas?
Remember what He wants more than anything else on His
birthday, IS THE LOVE OF OUR HEARTS.
original_subject: THIS CHRISTMAS IS CHRIST HAPPY OVER US?
original_verse_text: And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You on this special day, reflecting on the true meaning of love. May our hearts be filled with a deep, abiding love for You, not just a seasonal affection. Help us to love You as You have loved us, keeping Your commandments and seeking to please You in all we do. May our love for You be a satisfying, lasting love that brings You joy on this, Your birthday. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: This is a question I am asking myself this year. Let Us All Give This Question Some Serious Thought! This was a question a little girl asked her mom. How would you answer this question? Let us all give this some serious thought. Is the Lord happy about us on His birthday? Is He really happy, because He sees within our hearts a deep, true love for Him? Does He see a satisfying love and not just a seasonal affection stirred up by the festivities of Christmas? Remember what He wants more than anything else on His birthday, IS THE LOVE OF OUR HEARTS.
subject: This Christmas is Christ Happy over Us?
verse_text: And now these three remain: faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love.

original_content:
message_id: 16f1194a04ff9024
subject   : Subject: ASK--SEEK--KNOCK--(12-17-2019)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 16 Dec 2019 19:59:11 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Ask,** and it will be given to you; Seek, and you will find;*

* Knock, and it will be opened to you. *(Mt. 7:7)



*Today’s Thoughts:*

God the creator of all THINGS invites us to *Ask…seek…*

*knock. *Jesus had told the disciples, that He expected

them to be the light of the world (Mt. 5:14), and show

compassion, humility, purity, and love. *For the aid in *

*doing such things*, He exhorted them to pray fervently

for the Father’s blessing, in doing so they would

*receive…find…and it would be opened to them.*

Now as Christians we too are expected to be the

light of the world. Now in order to be able to show

compassion, humility purity, and love; we need to

*ask…seek…and knock. * In doing so God assures us

that He will hear and answer the prayers of His

children; so let us come boldly to the throne of grace.

*AND * *Like a father, He will answer according to *

*His good purpose.*

* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
God the creator of all THINGS invites us to Ask…seek… knock.
Jesus had told the disciples, that He expected them to be
the light of the world (Matthew 5:14), and show compassion,
humility, purity, and love. For the aid in doing such
things, He exhorted them to pray fervently for the Father’s
blessing, in doing so they would receive…find…and it would
be opened to them. Now as Christians we too are expected to
be the light of the world. Now in order to be able to show
compassion, humility purity, and love; we need to
ask…seek…and knock. In doing so God assures us that He will
hear and answer the prayers of His children; so let us come
boldly to the throne of grace. AND Like a father, He will
answer according to His good purpose.
original_verse_text:
Ask, and it will be given to you; Seek, and you will find;
Knock, and it will be opened to you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking Your guidance and strength. As Your children, we heed the call to be the light of the world, to show compassion, humility, purity, and love. We ask that You would empower us through the Holy Spirit to faithfully live out this calling. Help us to persistently ask, seek, and knock, knowing that You will hear and answer our prayers according to Your good purpose. We boldly approach Your throne of grace, trusting in Your abundant provision and love. Amen.
reflection: God the creator of all THINGS invites us to Ask…seek… knock. Jesus had told the disciples, that He expected them to be the light of the world (Matthew 5:14), and show compassion, humility, purity, and love. For the aid in doing such things, He exhorted them to pray fervently for the Father’s blessing, in doing so they would receive…find…and it would be opened to them. Now as Christians we too are expected to be the light of the world. Now in order to be able to show compassion, humility purity, and love; we need to ask…seek…and knock. In doing so God assures us that He will hear and answer the prayers of His children; so let us come boldly to the throne of grace. AND Like a father, He will answer according to His good purpose.
subject: Ask--Seek--Knock
verse_text:
Ask, and it will be given to you; Seek, and you will find;
Knock, and it will be opened to you.

original_content:
message_id: 16f1683fefbbb7e2
subject   : Subject: DO YOU RECOGNIZE CHRIST IN CHRISTMAS?
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 17 Dec 2019 18:59:07 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Thought: *(12-18-2019)

Now if I told you to write the word “Christmas” then as

you think about the word, write the first though that

flashes though your mind. This test was given to 40

psychology students. Here are some of the answers;

“*tree—holly—mistletoe—presents—turkey—holiday—*

*carols--and Santa Claus,” **but not one* had written,

“the birthday of Jesus.” As there was no room in the

inn so long ago, there is no room for Him today in the

celebration of Christmas. *This Christmas let each of *

*us give our hearts as a present to our Lord Jesus *

*Christ,* *Who gave so much for us.*

* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
Now if I told you to write the word “Christmas” then as you
think about the word, write the first though that flashes
though your mind. This test was given to 40 psychology
students. Here are some of the answers;
“tree—holly—mistletoe—presents—turkey—holiday— carols--and
Santa Claus,” but not one had written, “the birthday of
Jesus.” As there was no room in the inn so long ago, there
is no room for Him today in the celebration of Christmas.
This Christmas let each of us give our hearts as a present
to our Lord Jesus Christ, Who gave so much for us.
original_subject: DO YOU RECOGNIZE CHRIST IN CHRISTMAS?
original_verse_text:
And she brought forth her firstborn son, and wrapped him in
swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger; because there
was no room for them in the inn.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You this Christmas season, humbled by the knowledge that even as Your Son, our Lord Jesus Christ, was born in a humble manger, there was no room for Him in the inn. Help us to make room in our hearts and lives for the true meaning of Christmas – the birth of our Savior, who came to redeem us. May we offer our hearts as a precious gift to You, just as You have so graciously given Yourself to us. We pray this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: Now if I told you to write the word “Christmas” then as you think about the word, write the first though that flashes though your mind. This test was given to 40 psychology students. Here are some of the answers; “tree—holly—mistletoe—presents—turkey—holiday— carols--and Santa Claus,” but not one had written, “the birthday of Jesus.” As there was no room in the inn so long ago, there is no room for Him today in the celebration of Christmas. This Christmas let each of us give our hearts as a present to our Lord Jesus Christ, Who gave so much for us.
subject: Do You Recognize Christ in Christmas?
verse_text:
And she brought forth her firstborn son, and wrapped him in
swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger; because there
was no room for them in the inn.

original_content:
message_id: 16f1ba99f62fd4cd
subject   : Subject: KEEP CHRIST CENTRAL IN CHRISTMAS (12-19-2019)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 18 Dec 2019 18:58:19 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Hope for Us all: *

Let us remember, it is not the swaddling-clothes of

ceremonialism, but the Christ of the simple Gospel

story *constantly lived, *that shall make Christmas

perpetual in the heart of man. So, let’s make this

Christmas different; *let us find a variety of ways *

*of showing to others that God is indeed Immanuel,*

*God with us.*

* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
Today’s Hope for Us all: Let us remember, it is not the
swaddling-clothes of ceremonialism, but the Christ of the
simple Gospel story constantly lived, that shall make
Christmas perpetual in the heart of man. So, let’s make this
Christmas different; let us find a variety of ways of
showing to others that God is indeed Immanuel, God with us.
original_verse_text:
Behold, a virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth
a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel, which being
interpreted is, God with us.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that You have sent Your only begotten Son, the Word made flesh, to dwell among us. May the truth of Immanuel, God with us, fill our hearts with joy and inspire us to share the simple gospel story through our lives. Help us to find new ways this Christmas to demonstrate Your presence and love to all those around us. In the name of Jesus, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Today's Hope for Us All: Let us remember, it is not the swaddling clothes of ceremonialism, but the Christ of the simple Gospel story constantly lived, that shall make Christmas perpetual in the heart of man. So, let's make this Christmas different; let us find a variety of ways of showing to others that God is indeed Immanuel, God with us.
subject: Keep Christ Central in Christmas
verse_text:
Behold, a virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth
a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel, which being
interpreted is, God with us.

original_content:
message_id: 16f20c76d1e40e39
subject   : Subject: CHRISTMAS IS COSTLY (12-20-1920)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 19 Dec 2019 18:48:58 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Thoughts:*

*It cost Mary and Joseph* the comforts of home during a

long period of exile in Egypt to protect the little Babe.

*It cost mothers* in and around Bethlehem the massacre of

their babies by the cruel order of Herod.

*It cost the shepherds* the complacency of their shepherd’s

life with the call to the manger and to tell the “good
news.”

*It cost the wise men* a long journey and expensive gifts

and changed lives.

*It cost the early apostles and the early church*

persecution and sometimes death.

*It cost missionaries of Christ* untold suffering and

privation to spread the good news.

*It cost Christian martyrs* in all ages their lives for

Christ’s sake.

*More than all this, it cost God the Father* His own Son—

He sent Him to earth to save men.

*It cost Jesus* a life of sacrifice and service, a death cruel

and unmatched in history.

*Pastor Al *
original_reflection_text:
It cost Mary and Joseph the comforts of home during a long
period of exile in Egypt to protect the little Babe. It cost
mothers in and around Bethlehem the massacre of their babies
by the cruel order of Herod. It cost the shepherds the
complacency of their shepherd’s life with the call to the
manger and to tell the “good news.” It cost the wise men a
long journey and expensive gifts and changed lives. It cost
the early apostles and the early church persecution and
sometimes death. It cost missionaries of Christ untold
suffering and privation to spread the good news. It cost
Christian martyrs in all ages their lives for Christ’s sake.
More than all this, it cost God the Father His own Son— He
sent Him to earth to save men. It cost Jesus a life of
sacrifice and service, a death cruel and unmatched in
history.
original_verse_text:
Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us,
and sent his Son to be the propitiation for our sins.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of the great cost of Your love for us. You sent Your only Son, Jesus, to this earth to save us from our sins, even though it cost Him a life of sacrifice and a cruel death on the cross. We are humbled by the depth of Your love, which was demonstrated when Christ died for us while we were still sinners. May we never take for granted the immense price that was paid for our redemption. Help us to live lives worthy of such a great sacrifice, and to share the good news of Your salvation with all who need to hear it. Amen.
reflection: It cost Mary and Joseph the comforts of home during a long period of exile in Egypt to protect the little Babe. It cost mothers in and around Bethlehem the massacre of their babies by the cruel order of Herod. It cost the shepherds the complacency of their shepherd’s life with the call to the manger and to tell the “good news.” It cost the wise men a long journey and expensive gifts and changed lives. It cost the early apostles and the early church persecution and sometimes death. It cost missionaries of Christ untold suffering and privation to spread the good news. It cost Christian martyrs in all ages their lives for Christ’s sake. More than all this, it cost God the Father His own Son— He sent Him to earth to save men. It cost Jesus a life of sacrifice and service, a death cruel and unmatched in history.
subject: Christmas is Costly
verse_text:
Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us,
and sent his Son to be the propitiation for our sins.

original_content:
message_id: 16f25c4c5507bb7f
subject   : Subject: WHEN CHRISTMAS COMES (12-21-2019)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 20 Dec 2019 18:04:10 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Thoughts:*

Have you any old grudge you’d like to pay?

Any wrong laid up from a bygone day?

Gather them all now, and lay them away

When Christmas comes.

Hard thoughts are heavy to carry my friend,

And life is short from beginning to end;

Be kind to yourself—leave nothing to mend—

When Christmas comes.

*Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
Have you any old grudge you’d like to pay? Any wrong laid up
from a bygone day? Gather them all now, and lay them away
When Christmas comes. Hard thoughts are heavy to carry my
friend, And life is short from beginning to end; Be kind to
yourself—leave nothing to mend— When Christmas comes.
original_verse_text:
Be kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one
another, even as God for Christ’s sake hath forgiven you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the call to forgive one another as You have forgiven us. Help us to let go of any old grudges or wrongs that we have held onto, and to extend the same grace and compassion that You have shown us. May we be kind to ourselves and to others, leaving nothing unresolved as we celebrate the coming of Your Son, our Savior. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Have you any old grudge you'd like to pay? Any wrong laid up from a bygone day? Gather them all now, and lay them away when Christmas comes. Hard thoughts are heavy to carry, my friend, and life is short from beginning to end. Be kind to yourself—leave nothing to mend—when Christmas comes.
subject: When Christmas Comes
verse_text:
Be kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one
another, even as God for Christ’s sake hath forgiven you.

original_content:
message_id: 16f2b2b95b522c3a
subject   : Subject: A Christmas Prayer (12-22-20190
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 21 Dec 2019 19:14:34 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Wishing each of you a blessed Christmas,*

*with this prayer.*



*Let every heart keep *

* Christmas within—*

*Christ’s pity for sorrow,*

*Christ’s hatred for sin, *

*Christ’s care for the weakest.*

*Christ’s courage for right,*

*Everywhere, this **Christmas Night! *

* Amen.*



*Have a blessed Christmas!!!*

* Pastor Al & Marcie*
original_reflection_text:
Wishing each of you a blessed Christmas, with this prayer.
Let every heart keep Christmas within— Christ’s pity for
sorrow, Christ’s hatred for sin, Christ’s care for the
weakest. Christ’s courage for right, Everywhere, this
Christmas Night! Amen. Have a blessed Christmas!!!
original_verse_text:
For unto you is born this day in the city of David a
Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the precious gift of Your Son, Jesus Christ, who came to dwell among us, full of grace and truth. May our hearts keep Christmas within, reflecting Your pity for sorrow, Your hatred for sin, and Your care for the weakest. Fill us with the courage to stand for what is right, that Christ's light may shine through us this Christmas and always. Amen.
reflection: Wishing each of you a blessed Christmas, with this prayer. Let every heart keep Christmas within — Christ's pity for sorrow, Christ's hatred for sin, Christ's care for the weakest, Christ's courage for right. Everywhere, this Christmas night! Amen. Have a blessed Christmas!
subject: A Christmas Prayer
verse_text:
For unto you is born this day in the city of David a
Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.

original_content:
message_id: 16f2ff1046f7d1f9
subject   : Subject:DO NOT WEEP OVER WHAT YOU DO NOT HAVE--
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 22 Dec 2019 17:28:42 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*But decorate what you do have!*


*Today’s Thoughts: *(12-23-2019)

If we go out to seek joy, it will elude us, If

we go out to impart joy, we will find it.This

Christmas, whether you have little or much,

it makes no difference. It is your attitude that

counts. *Make Christmas a blessing for those *

*who have less then you.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
If we go out to seek joy, it will elude us, If we go out to
impart joy, we will find it.This Christmas, whether you have
little or much, it makes no difference. It is your attitude
that counts. Make Christmas a blessing for those who have
less then you.
original_subject: DO NOT WEEP OVER WHAT YOU DO NOT HAVE
original_verse_text: It is more blessed to give than to receive.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that true joy is found not in seeking it for ourselves, but in sharing it with others. Help us to be a light in the world, reflecting Your love and generosity, that we may be a blessing to those who have less than we do. May our attitudes and actions this Christmas season bring glory to Your name. We ask this in the precious name of Jesus. Amen.
reflection: If we go out to seek joy, it will elude us. If we go out to impart joy, we will find it. This Christmas, whether you have little or much, it makes no difference. It is your attitude that counts. Make Christmas a blessing for those who have less than you.
subject: Do Not Weep over What You Do Not Have
verse_text: It is more blessed to give than to receive.

original_content:
message_id: 16f35b30b934343d
subject   : Subject: SOME CHRISTMAS REMINDERS (12-24-2019)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 23 Dec 2019 20:18:44 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Thoughts:*

May the Christmas cheer remind you of Him who said, “Be of good cheer.”

May the Christmas bells remind you of the glorious proclamation of His
birth.

May the Christmas carols remind you of the song the angels sang “Glory
to God in the highest.”

May the Christmas season remind you in every way of Jesus Christ your
King.

*Pastor A*
original_reflection_text:
May the Christmas cheer remind you of Him who said, “Be of
good cheer.” May the Christmas bells remind you of the
glorious proclamation of His birth. May the Christmas carols
remind you of the song the angels sang “Glory to God in the
highest.” May the Christmas season remind you in every way
of Jesus Christ your King.
original_verse_text:
Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will
toward men.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, rejoicing in the birth of our Savior, Jesus Christ. May the Christmas cheer, bells, and carols fill us with the joy and peace that only You can provide. Help us to remember the glorious proclamation of Your Son's arrival and the song of the angels, that we may give "Glory to God in the highest." Guide us to keep our focus on Jesus, our King, throughout this season and always. Amen.
reflection: May the Christmas cheer remind you of Him who said, "Be of good cheer." May the Christmas bells remind you of the glorious proclamation of His birth. May the Christmas carols remind you of the song the angels sang, "Glory to God in the highest." May the Christmas season remind you in every way of Jesus Christ, your King.
subject: Some Christmas Reminders
verse_text:
Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will
toward men.

original_content:
message_id: 16f3a93ce70b925c
subject   : Subject: OPEN THE GIFT PACKAGE (12-25-2019)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 24 Dec 2019 19:02:43 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse: *(Lk. 2:7)

*Mary brought forth her firstborn Son, and wrapped*

*Him in swaddling cloths and laid Him in the manger, **because there was no
room for them in the inn.*



*Today’s Thoughts:*

There was a gift for each of us left under the Tree of Life 2,000 years ago
by Him whose birthday we

celebrate today. The gift was withheld from no man. Some have left the
packages unclaimed. Some have accepted the gift and carry it around, but
have failed to remove the wrappings and look inside to discover the hidden
splendor. The packages are all alike: in each is a scroll on which is
written, “All that the Father hath is thine. Take and live!” *Please* do
not neglect to accept this gift and open it and receive the wonderful
promise.

*Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
There was a gift for each of us left under the Tree of Life
2,000 years ago by Him whose birthday we celebrate today.
The gift was withheld from no man. Some have left the
packages unclaimed. Some have accepted the gift and carry it
around, but have failed to remove the wrappings and look
inside to discover the hidden splendor. The packages are all
alike: in each is a scroll on which is written, “All that
the Father hath is thine. Take and live!” Please do not
neglect to accept this gift and open it and receive the
wonderful promise.
original_verse_text:
Mary brought forth her firstborn Son, and wrapped
Him in swaddling cloths and laid Him in the manger, because
there was no room for them in the inn.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of Your Son, born this day to bring salvation to all who believe. Help us to receive this precious gift with open hearts, that we may discover the hidden splendor of Your promises and live according to Your will. May we not leave this gift unclaimed, but embrace it fully, knowing that all that You have is ours through the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: There was a gift for each of us left under the Tree of Life 2,000 years ago by Him whose birthday we celebrate today. The gift was withheld from no man. Some have left the packages unclaimed. Some have accepted the gift and carry it around, but have failed to remove the wrappings and look inside to discover the hidden splendor. The packages are all alike: in each is a scroll on which is written, “All that the Father hath is thine. Take and live!” Please do not neglect to accept this gift and open it and receive the wonderful promise.
subject: Open the Gift Package
verse_text:
Mary brought forth her firstborn Son, and wrapped
Him in swaddling cloths and laid Him in the manger, because
there was no room for them in the inn.

original_content:
message_id: 16f3f7fae5e00c30
subject   : Subject: PATIENCE--PATIENCE--PATIENCE--(12-26-2019)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 25 Dec 2019 17:58:50 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*When the fullness of time had come, God sent forth*

*His Son born of a woman, born under the law.*

(Gal. 4:4)



*Today’s Thoughts:*

*(When the right time came) *God sent His Son to die for our sins. The Jews
had been waiting and waiting for the Messiah—but God’s timing was perfect.
I think we have all been guilty of wondering if God will ever answer our
prayers; BUT we must never doubt Him or give up hope.

At the right time He will respond. Are you waiting on God’s timing? *Trust
His judgment and trust that He has your **interests in mind.*

* Pastor Al *
original_reflection_text:
(When the right time came) God sent His Son to die for our
sins. The Jews had been waiting and waiting for the
Messiah—but God’s timing was perfect. I think we have all
been guilty of wondering if God will ever answer our
prayers; BUT we must never doubt Him or give up hope. At the
right time He will respond. Are you waiting on God’s timing?
Trust His judgment and trust that He has your interests in
mind.
original_verse_text:
When the fullness of time had come, God sent forth His Son
born of a woman, born under the law.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the perfect timing of Your plan to send Your Son, Jesus, to die for our sins. Though we may grow impatient and doubt Your timing, help us to trust in Your perfect judgment and the certainty of Your loving care for us. May we wait upon You with unwavering faith, knowing that in Your time, You will answer our prayers and fulfill Your purposes. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: When the right time came, God sent His Son to die for our sins. The Jews had been waiting and waiting for the Messiah—but God's timing was perfect. I think we have all been guilty of wondering if God will ever answer our prayers, but we must never doubt Him or give up hope. At the right time, He will respond. Are you waiting on God's timing? Trust His judgment and trust that He has your interests in mind.
subject: Patience--Patience--Patience
verse_text:
When the fullness of time had come, God sent forth His Son
born of a woman, born under the law.

original_content:
message_id: 16f49f3f32223ef6
subject   : Subject: DON'T GIVE UP!! (12-28-2019)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 27 Dec 2019 18:42:02 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Consider Him who has endured such hostility by sinners*

*against Himself, so that you may not grow weary and*

*lose heart. *(Heb. 12:3)



*Today’s Thoughts:*

The successful life prescribed by Christ requires faithfulness until death:
a hand on the plow with no looking back, steadfast perseverance; racing
hared

for the tape, fighting the good fight of faith. The devil loves it when we
simply relax our efforts. A secret for success is: “fight just one more round.
Be brave for

five more minutes.” *It is the difference **between *

*defeat and victory.*

* Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
The successful life prescribed by Christ requires
faithfulness until death: a hand on the plow with no looking
back, steadfast perseverance; racing hared for the tape,
fighting the good fight of faith. The devil loves it when we
simply relax our efforts. A secret for success is: “fight
just one more round. Be brave for five more minutes.” It is
the difference between defeat and victory.
original_verse_text:
Consider Him who has endured such hostility by sinners
against Himself, so that you may not grow weary and lose
heart.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the promise of the crown of life that You have prepared for those who love You and endure trials with steadfast faith (James 1:12). Grant us the strength to fix our eyes on Jesus, the author and perfecter of our faith, that we may not grow weary or lose heart in the face of opposition (Hebrews 12:3). Help us to persevere, to fight the good fight, and to finish the race you have set before us, that we may receive the eternal reward You have promised. In Your Son's name we pray, Amen.
reflection: The successful life prescribed by Christ requires faithfulness until death: a hand on the plow with no looking back, steadfast perseverance; racing hard for the tape, fighting the good fight of faith. The devil loves it when we simply relax our efforts. A secret for success is: "fight just one more round. Be brave for five more minutes." It is the difference between defeat and victory.
subject: Don't Give Up!!
verse_text:
Consider Him who has endured such hostility by sinners
against Himself, so that you may not grow weary and lose
heart.

original_content:
message_id: 16f4f2c517aa3f16
subject   : Subject: THE GIFT OF GRACE (12-29-2019)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 28 Dec 2019 19:01:42 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*For by grace you have been save through faith, And *

*that not** of yourselves; it is a gift of God, not of works, lest
anyone **should
boast. *(Eph. 2:8,9)

*Today’s Reminder:*

What Paul is really saying in these two verses is;

“we are saved by *grace *alone, through *faith* alone,

in *Christ *alone.” Our works should be out of appreciation for what Christ
has done for us.

I am reminded of what a friend once said to me;

“Remember we can never out give God, He has

a bigger shovel.”

*Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
What Paul is really saying in these two verses is; “we are
saved by grace alone, through faith alone, in Christ alone.”
Our works should be out of appreciation for what Christ has
done for us. I am reminded of what a friend once said to me;

“Remember we can never out give God, He has a bigger
shovel.”
original_verse_text:
For by grace you have been save through faith, And that not
of yourselves; it is a gift of God, not of works, lest
anyone should boast.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our salvation is a gift of Your grace, not earned by our own works. We are humbled by the truth that it is through faith in Christ alone that we are saved, not by any merit of our own. Lord, may our lives be a reflection of our appreciation for the great sacrifice You have made on our behalf. Help us to remember that we can never outgive You, for Your generosity knows no bounds. In the name of Jesus, we pray. Amen.
reflection: What Paul is really saying in these two verses is, "we are saved by grace alone, through faith alone, in Christ alone." Our works should be out of appreciation for what Christ has done for us. I am reminded of what a friend once said to me, "Remember we can never out-give God, He has a bigger shovel."
subject: The Gift of Grace
verse_text:
For by grace you have been save through faith, And that not
of yourselves; it is a gift of God, not of works, lest
anyone should boast.

original_content:
message_id: 16f543c220ac2674
subject   : Subject: NOW IS ALL THE TIME WE HAVE (12-30-2019)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 29 Dec 2019 18:37:05 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Some Thoughts to Remember:*

1. Remember that this maybe the day the Lord returns. (Ps. 118:24)

2. Use time wisely, make the most of every opportunity. (Col. 4:5)

3. Treat everyone as if you’ll never see them

again. (Acts 10:37, 38)



If we truly believe now is all the time we have, what a

difference that will make in our lives. It’s great to be a

part of the family of God.

*Pastor Al*
original_reflection_text:
Some Thoughts to Remember:

1. Remember that this maybe the day the Lord returns. (Psalm 118:24)

2. Use time wisely, make the most of every opportunity.
(Colossians 4:5)

3. Treat everyone as if you’ll never see them again. (Acts
10:37, 38)

If we truly believe now is all the time we have, what a
difference that will make in our lives. It’s great to be a
part of the family of God.
original_subject: NOW IS ALL THE TIME WE HAVE
original_verse_text: This is the day which the Lord hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for this day that You have made. Help us to make the most of every opportunity, using our time wisely and treating others with the love and grace that You have shown us. May we live each moment as if it could be our last, ever mindful of Your imminent return. We are grateful to be part of Your family, and we pray that our lives would reflect the hope and joy we have in You. Amen.
reflection: Some Thoughts to Remember: 1. Remember that this may be the day the Lord returns. (Psalm 118:24) 2. Use time wisely, make the most of every opportunity. (Colossians 4:5) 3. Treat everyone as if you'll never see them again. (Acts 10:37, 38) If we truly believe now is all the time we have, what a difference that will make in our lives. It's great to be a part of the family of God.
subject: Now is All the Time We Have
verse_text: This is the day which the Lord hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
